documents.content:
# SGMA Implementation Status 2026

## What is SGMA?

The Sustainable Groundwater Management Act (2014) established a framework for local groundwater sustainability.

### Key Legislation
- AB 1739
- SB 1168
- SB 1319

## Current Status

### Groundwater Sustainability Agencies (GSAs)
- All high and medium priority basins have GSAs formed
- GSAs manage groundwater locally
- Joint powers agreements common for multi-agency basins

### Groundwater Sustainability Plans (GSPs)
- **Critically overdrafted basins:** Plans due January 31, 2020
- **Other high/medium priority basins:** Plans due January 31, 2022
- All first-round plans submitted
- DWR reviewing and providing feedback

## 2025-26 Groundwater Conditions

### Statewide Overview
- Water Year 2025: Below-average precipitation
- Groundwater levels: Relatively stable compared to recent years
- Improvement from drought conditions of prior decade

### Groundwater Level Trends (Spring 2024-2025)
| Trend | % of Wells |
|-------|------------|
| Stable | 72% |
| Increase (>5 ft) | 13% |
| Decline (>5 ft) | 15% |

### Ongoing Challenges
- Active land subsidence in Central Valley
- Sacramento River region affected
- San Joaquin River region affected
- Tulare Lake region affected
- Infrastructure impacts from subsidence

### Positive Signs
- Fewer domestic wells drilled (lowest in decade)
- Fewer dry well reports (lowest in 5 years)
- 235 real-time monitoring sites operational

## SGMA Requirements

### Six Sustainability Indicators
GSAs must avoid undesirable results in:

1. **Chronic lowering of groundwater levels**
2. **Significant reduction in groundwater storage**
3. **Seawater intrusion**
4. **Degraded water quality**
5. **Land subsidence**
6. **Depletions of interconnected surface water**

### 20-Year Sustainability Goal
- GSPs must achieve sustainability within 20 years
- Measurable objectives required
- Minimum thresholds established
- Annual reporting to DWR

## DWR Resources

### Groundwater Reports
- **Semi-Annual Conditions Update:** Released October 2025
- **California Groundwater Update 2025 (Bulletin 118):** Draft released, final Spring 2026
- Incorporates GSA annual reports
- CalGW Live data 2020-2024

### GSA Formation Notification System
- SGMA Portal on DWR website
- Track GSA formation status
- Public access to GSP documents

## Well Owners in SGMA Basins

### What You May Need to Know
- Your GSA may require well registration
- Extraction reporting may be required
- Fees may apply
- Check with local GSA

### Finding Your GSA
- DWR SGMA Portal
- County water agency
- Local water district

## Resources

**DWR SGMA:** [SGMA Groundwater Sustainability](https://water.ca.gov/Programs/Groundwater-Management/SGMA-Groundwater-Management)
**SGMA Portal:** [SGMA Implementation Status 2026](https://sgma.water.ca.gov)
**State Water Board SGMA:** [Sgma](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/sgma/)

## Take Action
1. Learn more at [Sgma Groundwater Management](https://water.ca.gov/Programs/Groundwater-Management/SGMA-Groundwater-Management).
2. Learn more at [New Reports Show Progress In Community Actions To Make Groundwater Sustainability A Reality](https://water.ca.gov/News/News-Releases/2025/Oct-25/New-Reports-Show-Progress-in-Community-Actions-to-Make-Groundwater-Sustainability-a-Reality).
3. Learn more at [SGMA Implementation Status 2026](https://sgma.water.ca.gov).
4. Learn more at [Sgma](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/sgma/).
